Articles.Content:
Simple question, but just wondering what everyone else's were: whats your favourite moon in KSP?

Mine is Gilly, purely because of its terrain and low gravity (makes for lots of EVA fun ):
Minmus! It looks like it's made of mint ice cream, and I always want to lick it.

Pol, for having the second lowest gravity and fo its insane mountains.

Only downside of Pol is being really far away.
So far for me the good old Mun, as i have yet to land on any moon other than that or Minmus.
Gotta be Minmus. It's beautiful. But I've yet to properly explore the extra-kerbinar moons yet, so may find another. Gilly does sound fun...

Minimus. I have a mapping mission there now. (ISA MapSat is so cool.)

Granted, I haven't really explored much beyond Kerbin. At least successfully. Now that I have MapSat, I plan on sending probes all over the place.
Vall to me. The color, terrain, it just looks cool.
THE MÃƒÂ¼n, because I've only gone to the MÃƒÂ¼n and Minmus.
Gilly, because its low gravity is cool.
Laythe, it looks nice and I managed to get there with my SSTO Spaceplane (I needed to stop for refuel at station at high kerbin orbit though)

Pol!

Perdy, easy to land on/get to (for me), low gravity for fun, mountians (fun for trying to land on, and trying not to hit), and its beautiful.
Pol! Low gravity and awsome spiky rocks!

Have to say Laythe, even thou my probe only did a pass by of it last night (for myself at least) as I see all that water and say,"Gee I cannot wait to pilot boats and subs on it. I wonder what type of fishies are on it too." Next up. Minmus. For the reason I have my first Kerbal colony started on it.
